title: ICE: Unexpected tail in unsized_info_ty
body:
The following code causes a compiler panic:

``` rust
pub trait A<T> {}

pub enum C<T> {
    A(A<T>),
}

fn main() {
    let _: Option<Box<C<&str>>> = None;
}
```

``` console
$ rustup run nightly rustc x.rs
error: internal compiler error: ../src/librustc_trans/type_of.rs:178: Unexpected tail in unsized_info_ty: C<&str> for ty=C<&str>
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', ../src/libsyntax/errors/mod.rs:584
```
